required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Subcutaneous Progesterone in Frozen- Thawed Single Euploid Blastocyst Transfer.
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Controlled, Double-blind, Double-dummy Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Subcutaneous Progesterone Compared to Vaginal Progesterone for Luteal Phase Support in Modified Natural Frozen Euploid Blastocyst Transfer.

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multicenter, randomized, double-blind, double-dummy, active-controlled, non-inferiority clinical study in women aged 35 to 42 years. This study will investigate the safety and efficacy of Progesterone-IBSA to support euploid embryo blastocyst implantation and early pregnancy after frozen embryo transfer (FET) in a modified natural cycle as a treatment for infertile women. Subjects will be randomized to receive either active Progesterone-IBSA or Crinone 8% for luteal and early pregnancy support and these two groups will be compared.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: defined by the presence of an intrauterine fetal heart beat
defined by the presence of an ongoing intrauterine pregnancy with fetal heart beat

secondary_outcome.description: positive serum Î²-human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) test rate
defined by the number of gestational sacs observed at Visit 6 by means of a transvaginal ultrasound (TVUS), divided by the number of blastocysts transferred (%)
defined as the number of deliveries with at least one live birth or stillbirth (%)

defined as the complete expulsion or extraction from a woman of a product of fertilization, after 22 completed weeks of gestational age; which, after such separation, breathes or shows any other evidence of life

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from treatment start until 10 weeks of pregnancy
secondary_outcome.description: defined as number of subjects dropping form the study at any time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events related to the mother
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from Informed consent signature until 2-4 week after delivery.
secondary_outcome.description: frequency and severity of adverse events related to the mother.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the 4th day of treatment administration until 10 weeks post embryo transfer.
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit, the subject will be queried about the presence of local reactions at administration site (pain, redness, swelling and itching at injection site and pain, irritation, swelling and leakage in the genital area). Events will be described in term of nature, severity (mild, moderate, severe, or very severe) and duration (persisted for up to 1 hour, persisted for more than 1 up to 4 hours, persisted for more than 4 up to 12 hours, persisted for more than 12 hours).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from 5 weeks post embryo transfer until the 12th week of pregnancy.
secondary_outcome.description: defined as a spontaneous loss of an intra-uterine pregnancy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: after the 12th week of pregnancy until delivery.
secondary_outcome.description: defined as a spontaneous loss of an intra-uterine pregnancy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from 5 weeks post embryo transfer until the 12th week of pregnancy.
secondary_outcome.description: defined as a pregnancy outside the uterine cavity, diagnosed by ultrasound, surgical visualization or histopathology.

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse events related to the newborn.
secondary_outcome.description: frequency and severity of adverse events related to the newborn.

other_outcome.description: Blood sampling to assess Progesterone levels will be collected in order to characterize the PK profile at steady state in the target population

arm_group.description: Progesterone-IBSA 25mg, twice daily (BID) subcutaneous (SC) injection every 12 hours and Crinone Placebo, once daily (QD) intravaginally.
Crinone 8%, 90 mg, QD intravaginally and Progesterone-IBSA Placebo, BID SC Injection every 12 hours

intervention.description: Progesterone-IBSA 25mg, twice daily (BID) SC Injection every 12 hours
Vaginal gel Placebo, once daily (QD) intravaginally
Placebo injectable solution, BID SC Injection every 12 hours
